description: Validated biomarker triplets for FRANCIS survival stratification

rationale.CXCL13: Universal immune anchor - B-cell recruitment for TLS formation
rationale.SOX2: Cancer stem cell marker - self-renewal and treatment resistance
rationale.LGALS1: Galectin-1 - CNS immunosuppression via T-cell apoptosis

rationale.CXCL13: Universal immune anchor - B-cell recruitment for TLS formation
Universal immune anchor - B-cell recruitment for TLS formation
Universal immune anchor - B-cell recruitment for TLS formation
Universal immune anchor - B-cell recruitment for TLS formation
Universal immune anchor - B-cell recruitment for TLS formation
rationale.PDCD1: PD-1 - T-cell exhaustion and checkpoint engagement

rationale.CXCL13: Universal immune anchor - B-cell recruitment for TLS formation

universal_marker.mechanism_solid_tumors: Recruits B-lymphocytes that form tertiary lymphoid structures (TLS) within tumor microenvironment, enabling anti-tumor immune response
universal_marker.note: Mechanism differs from B-cell malignancies where CXCL13 promotes autocrine tumor survival

intermediate_instability_regime.description: Genomic instability regime where tumors occupy metastable state with impaired immune surveillance
intermediate_instability_regime.phenomenon: Intermediate Instability Trap - paradoxically worse survival than both low and high instability

validation_totals.analysis_method: Log-rank survival analysis with median DII split

DLBC.reason: B-cell lymphoma - CXCL13 mechanism is opposite (autocrine survival signaling)
DLBC.note: In B-cell malignancies, CXCL13 produced by malignant cells promotes tumor survival

patents.title: Systems and Methods for Predicting and Controlling Physiological Collapse Using Dynamical Biomarker Indices
Methods, Systems, and Kits for Pan-Cancer Survival Stratification Using CXCL13-Anchored Biomarker Triplets Within Intermediate Genomic Instability Regimes
